intro: [WRONG START] Symphoricocarpos occidentalis var. quercifolia, commonly known as the Pacific blackcap, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its small, dark purple to black berries that ripen in the fall. The plant has alternate, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often hairy and have a serrated margin. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in riparian zones and woodlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems, providing food for birds and small mammals.
